metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18651 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Xpdf 4.00. catalog->getNumPages() in AcroForm.cc allows attackers to launch a denial of service (hang caused by large loop) via a specific pdf file, as demonstrated by pdftohtml. This is mainly caused by a large number after the /Count field in the file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18651` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xpdf - 3.03-17
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 mdeslaur> no indication this affects poppler

criterions.comment: ipe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
libextractor: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
xpdf package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.03-17').
